page.title: 01LIFE AROUND LOWER HARDRES
page.content: Lower Hardres Parish with a population of about 800 lies on the B2068 Hythe road 5 kilometres south of Canterbury. To the east and north-east it adjoins Chartham and Thanington Parishes. The downland is a patchwork of farms and orchards crossed by ancient bridleways. The winding lanes are narrow many bear an oak tree symbol denoting a scenic route. In contrast steel pylons carrying overhead power lines interrupt the view. Nackington church, is 11th century Lower Hardres church, school and inn, 19th century. Houses are a mixture of very old and modern prestige. The area is prosperous, inhabited by professionals working in Canterbury and London, farmers and their employees and retired people. They enjoy village life, fear development closure of school, loss of bus services.
